data.title: 4 Best Go-Kart Tracks in Los Angeles, California
data.meta_description: What are the best go-kart tracks in Los Angeles? Look no further for the answers.
data.text:
Los Angeles is known for many things, including its beautiful beaches, stunning scenery, and movie stars. However, for those who love racing and speed, it’s the go-kart tracks that really get the blood pumping.

With several tracks located in and around Los Angeles, it can be difficult to choose which one to visit. In this article, we’ll take a look at four of the best go-kart tracks in Los Angeles.

Go Kart Tracks in Los Angeles

K1 Speed Burbank – Los Angeles

K1 Speed Torrance – Los Angeles

MB2 Raceway Sylmar

Go Kart World

1. K1 Speed Burbank – Los Angeles

Located in the heart of Burbank, K1 Speed offers a thrilling indoor go-kart racing experience. The track is designed to test the skills of even the most experienced racers, with tight turns, hairpin corners, and long straightaways. The electric karts used at K1 Speed are fast, with speeds reaching up to 45 miles per hour.

In addition to the track, K1 Speed also features a comfortable lounge area where racers can relax and enjoy food and drinks. The facility also offers party packages for those looking to celebrate a special occasion.

Visit the K1 Speed Burbank Website

2. K1 Speed Torrance – Los Angeles

K1 Speed’s Torrance location offers another exciting indoor go-karting experience. The track at this facility is longer than the one at the Burbank location, with more opportunities for racers to show off their skills. The karts used at K1 Speed Torrance are the same as those at the Burbank location, with speeds reaching up to 45 miles per hour.

Like the Burbank location, K1 Speed Torrance also offers a comfortable lounge area and party packages for groups. Additionally, K1 Speed Torrance features an arcade area with a variety of games for racers and non-racers alike.

Visit the K1 Speed Torrance Website

3. MB2 Raceway Sylmar

MB2 Raceway in Sylmar is an indoor/outdoor go-kart facility that offers a unique racing experience. The outdoor track is a quarter-mile long, with a variety of turns and straightaways that make for an exciting race. The electric karts used at MB2 Raceway are fast and responsive, with speeds reaching up to 45 miles per hour.

In addition to the outdoor track, MB2 Raceway also features an indoor track that is perfect for those looking to race in any weather conditions. The indoor track is slightly smaller than the outdoor one but still offers plenty of excitement. MB2 Raceway also has a comfortable lounge area and party packages available.

4. Go Kart World

Go Kart World is an outdoor go-kart facility located in Carson, just south of Los Angeles. The facility features three different tracks, each with its own unique layout and challenges. The tracks at Go Kart World are all asphalt, providing a smooth and fast racing experience.

The karts used at Go Kart World are gas-powered, which provides a different racing experience than the electric karts used at other facilities. The karts can reach speeds up to 40 miles per hour, and there are different sizes available for both kids and adults.

In addition to the tracks, Go Kart World also has batting cages, an arcade, and a snack bar. The facility also offers party packages for those looking to celebrate a special occasion.

Conclusion

Whether you’re a seasoned racer or a first-time driver, there’s a go-kart track in Los Angeles that will satisfy your need for speed. From the indoor tracks at K1 Speed to the outdoor track at Go Kart World, there’s something for everyone. Each of the four tracks we’ve reviewed here offers a unique racing experience, so be sure to check them all out and find your favorite.
